author: Anna Toon
title: 17 Austin Craft Beer Destinations, Winter 2017
text:
17 Austin Craft Beer Destinations, Winter 2017 All Jan 26, 2017, 4:09pm CST Pouring a beer at WhichCraft WhichCraft Beer Store/Facebook 
Austin’s craft beer scene is thriving, clearly seen with the expanding number of breweries setting forth for the city (and growing). This means there is certainly no shortage of places to grab excellent local brews from Live Oak Brewing, Austin Beer Works, Hops & Grain, and more. 
Find beer gardens like the Dirty Sixth oasis of Easy Tiger , the Texas-obsessed list from Craft Pride (which pairs wonderfully with Detroit-style pizza), the sturdy options of Workhorse Bar , and others. Here is Eater’s updated take on the best places for pints this winter, including WhichCraft ’s Mueller taproom, new brewery St. Elmo , Aviator Pizza ’s drafthouse, and more. 
For a guide to the best breweries with taprooms and tours in the Austin-area, Eater has you covered here . Looking for other boozy options? There are cocktails both new and essential , wine , and happy hours . 
Everything below is unranked. Don’t see your favorite new or crucial craft beer hub on the list? Chime in on the tipline , the comments, or over on the forum . 1 Craft Pride 
Often dubbed one of the country’s best beer bars, this Rainey Street destination features 54 expertly curated Texas taps and Detroit-style pizza from Via 313. Well-educated staff, an expansive patio, and bottle shop round out the offering.
